intro: Prunus korshinskyi, commonly known as the Chinese bird cherry, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers in early spring, which are followed by edible drupes that turn red when mature. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Prunus korshinskyi prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to a variety of garden settings.
